newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia rupiah lower, swaps up on Thai spillover.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia rupiah lower, swaps up on Thai spillover.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was lower against the dollar and swap premiums increased in late trading on Thursday following a spillover of the crisis in Thailand.
Dealers said volume was modest, but the underlying tone had turned biddish on the dollar, aided by relatively ample domestic liquidity.

Thai's finance and commerce ministers resigned on Thursday, sparking a slew of unloading of regional currencies, including the rupiah. Offshore investors continued to overborrow the rupiah, fearing the central bank might take action to control the swap market.
Offshore purchases lifted the dollar through the 2,430 barrier, but further rises were limited by local selling.
One U.S. bank dealer said short dollar covering ahead of the weekend was also among the factors which caused the softening.
He said the dollar upturn could not maintain for very long because operators would need more rupiah due to the month-end factor and half-year book closing.
"There could be some window-dressing approaching the six-month reports. People would need more rupiah," he said.
Spot rupiah was at 2,430.75/31.00 at 0845 GMT against an opening 2,427.75/28.50.
Tomorrow and today rupiah closed at 2,430.25/30.50 and 2,428.0/28.3, respectively.
Overnight rupiah was at seven percent. Overnight swaps were at 0.25/0.30 and tom/next at 0.3/0.5 points.
One-month swaps edged up to 13.75/14.25 from 13.50/14.00, two to 29.5/30.5 from 27.5/29.5, three to 42.00/42.25 from 41.0/42.0 and six to 82.0/83.0 from 81.0/82.0 points.
The central bank raised its intervention band by one point to 2,423/2,615 and its conversion band also by one point to 2,423/2,471 on Thursday.
